text:
Few points to note:
1. This is a summary of the best smartphones to get in 2019 SO FAR, for if you wanted to buy a phone now.  Obviously there'll be plenty more, and I will summarise all of them at the end of the year!
2. The rank order is personal preference, and it may vary somewhat for each buyer depending on exactly what features you're looking for.
3.  The prices I have written are not necessarily launch prices - they're the best prices I could find for each phone from reputable sources
4. What's YOUR favourite phone this year?﻿

author: Dritan Rustja

text: @Dritan Rustja I like it a lot too. I have the Aurora one, color and build quality is nice. The battery is good too, it can go through a day without struggle (but I didn't play it all day though). Screen is superb, feels just a bit below my iPhone X quality. It's a complete package for me, except lacks of wireless charging (not a deal breaker anyway, I still charge many things with cables). Underscreen fingerprint scanner is faster than Mate 20 Pro, and as fast as my 1+6T. Telephoto never been my thing so 3X optical zoom for me is more than enough. But I'm more happy with the super wide camera which is the same with the Pro one. And the main camera even with a stop slower (f/1.6 -> f/1.8) from Pro, still shoots really great photos. And you can use Night Mode if you want more lights. OH! and macro shooting is super awesome! That's it!﻿

text: I did enjoy the video, of mostly on target.  But while I don't own the phone because I have an s10+, I think you missed the mark the LG G8 ThinQ, OK it has that gimmick with the hand scanner, but otherwise it's right up there, and already discounted to $700.00 unlocked from a reputable dealer, or less on some carriers who are giving $200 Visa cards which could bring it down to $620.00.  At about $300 less. I would have bought this instead.  It's cameras are  great.  While no on screen fingerprint scanner, the rear scanner is fast, it's face unlock is more secure.  The screen while not as good as Samsung is still pretty damned good and QHD.  I just don't think it gets the respect.  But is starting to sell stateside.  While I wouldn't  but it in the top 5, I would in the top 15.  I also understand this is more a global audience and price differences may vary do to regions.  The G8 also isn't one  hottest in design but more function over looks.  Every company has it's gimmicks, not only LG.﻿

author: MOHD NADEEM

text: Whilst I realize no 2 individuals may agree on the same devices worthiness for Top 15 list, I do have some serious issues with this video. 1. Like too many other YT reviewers, you seem too biased toward both Samsung and Apple and possibly Pixel. Aside from the propensity to favour OEMs that dominate sales and merely because they provide free devices and merchandise, you also 2. Denigrate Smartphones from Manufacturers that make revered devices like LG (this time their G8) which you go out of your way to exhort viewers not to buy. In the case of the G8, at as low as $620US from T-Mobile, this devices checks boxes left unchecked by all of your other choices in the Top 15, including 2 Year Warranty,  Unparalleled Audio via headphones, best-in-class voice call reception and camera interface which allows for manual control that potentially outdoes image quality of the rest except Zoom on P30Pro. Add to that its snazzy colours, smooth rear-mounted cameras and performace that no lay person will be able to distinguish from the S10s and Huaweis. I have news for you. The unwashed, totally novice Smartphone buyer has little interest in your tech site. The rest of us who are fanatics or such deserve the type of impartiality that Reviewers who spend their own money tend to provide (the Flossy Carters and Juan B's of YouTube world). Don't misunderstand me,  i loved a number of your Camera test vids etc. but this video reveals your biases in an undeniable way.﻿

As someone who bought the regular P30, I can agree with what's been said here. It's still an excellent phone all round, but honestly the Mate 20 Pro is just better. 

The cameras are almost identical to the point where it's hard to tell them apart, they both have a Kirin 980 and the Mate has a better quality display and bigger battery (plus wireless charging).

author: Surreal Being

text:
Honestly, my daily driver is a Xiaomi Mi Mix 3.
This phone is incredible, I value my screen real estate more than many other features, an I love looking at my 93.4% STBR and comparing it to many other phones, it is almost flawless.
I got the device Day 1 from China with a China ROM and flashed global when it was available, so I've probably been using the phone more than most people, the sliding mechanism is still in pristine condition and there is no damage to the phone whatsoever.
The camera is also magnificent, although the denoising isn't very good in lowlight, so I actually use a flashed Google Pixel 3 camera on this device.
Only 2 problems are the lack of waterproofing and scarce accessories (Cases are hard to come buy and screen protectors are a bitch to get on, so much so that I've vouched to go without one and use liquid reinforced protection instead).﻿

author: Matthew Brew

text:
i'll take the note 9 over any galaxy s10 any day! (even the 5g s10)
* no fucking notch. the hole in the screen is still a notch.
* iris unlocking. faster and more secure than face unlock.
* no fucking notch.
* capacitive fingerprint scanner on the back. granted it is not as good as having it on the side, but it is 10 times better than under the screen! it is faster and more secure!
* no hole in the the display to break the immersion.
* the S pen it AMAZING!
* because of the fucking notch on the s10, the notification bar at the top is much thicker. making for a lot of wasted space and ugly UI.
* the screen on the Note (which doesn't have a hole) is much brighter than the S10. and also can get much darker!
* did i mention the fucking hole in the display of the s10? that shit is fucking horrible!!!
* the sound quality on the note 9 is superior. louder and crisper
* the "3d touch" on the home button is extremely useful. much better than swipes.
but most importantly, the note 9 does not have a fucking disgusting horrible hole in the display!﻿

One test showed the Exynos open Asphalt 9 faster, the other showed the 855 opening it faster, which proves what I say about margin of error .  I don't take the ridiculous speed test by a shill like PhoneBuff seriously. The guy at Phone Battles said to me that he cut the speed test because they were about the same and the video would be very long. In another test, the guy said they were about the same, but showed that the battery life wasn't as good on the Exynos. Most people won't notice the speed difference in real life, the reactions of people saying they will send their phone back is just ridiculous and shows the strange reactionary culture we live in. Sheeple can easily get wound up about something that is quite minor.﻿

author: Robert Barnes

text:
Why bash the Note 9 ? Just cause you don't like it ? I got the Note 9 ( and a Mate 20 Pro ) and the Note is still a beast.  With a good sense of taking care of it and a normal usage .. it still gets me 6 hours and half of SOT in a heavy day and 8 hours in a chill day. My maximum was 10 hours and half of SOT. Weaker battery life my ass. And what ... S10+ opens an app 1 second faster and that is WoWoW ? Yeah tell the Average Joe that ... he might be veeery amazed ...... not. The camera system is good for its age. Yeah you don't have a ultra wide ... so what ? The front facing camera is not WOW material on the S10+ either.  You gonna get the hearts and likes anyhow on social media ... so ... ? Speaking of bezels ... at least the bezels are symmetrical unlike the hole punch. The fingerprint scanner never ever failed me while the ultrasonic one is still hit and miss even after updates. 

I understand the marketing gimmick here ... promoting the S10 ... but come on ... Note 9 is aging very well and people should consider it too. For the price of the Note 9 right now ... it offers one of best packages. A solid phone for at least 2 more years. Your channel is watched by normal people too, you know ? Not only by tech-ies, phone collectors or rich people that can afford to change their phones at 6 months or yearly etc. So speak right my man.﻿
